availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Burwell N. Carter (Grant County, Kentucky, teacher, minister.)

body.p: Grant County, Kentucky, teacher, minister. Virginia native. Married Emily Lemmon Carter in Grant County, Kentucky on April 2, 1848. Father of Kemp G. Carter, John H. Carter, and James T. Carter. School teacher in Grant County in 1850. Minister in the Methodist Episcopal Church, South in Grant County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Grant County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Grant County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 358A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 111.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Williamstown, p. 982.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 40B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Grant County Marriages, Film #001490815, p. 280 of 742.
